sentences.sContent: But it contained one very interesting piece of data: in 2008, for the first time in sixteen years, the finance and insurance industry shrank.
sentences.sContent_eng: But it contained one very interesting piece of data: in 2008, for the first time in sixteen years, the finance and insurance industry shrank.
sentences.sCn: 但是，这份报告里有一项非常耐人寻味的数据：在2008年，金融保险业出现近十六年来的首次萎缩。

sentences.sContent: The physician who lives in the Chicago area invested heavily in stocks, only to cringe as the value of his portfolio shrank 42% over the last decade.
sentences.sContent_eng: The physician who lives in the Chicago area invested heavily in stocks, only to cringe as the value of his portfolio shrank 42% over the last decade.
sentences.sCn: 这位医生住在芝加哥地区，将大量投资投入到股票上，只有在他的投资价值于过去十年缩水42%的事实才令他退缩。

sentences.sContent: Canada's economy shrank at an annual rate of 5.4% in the first quarter, its biggest decline since 1991, but less than economists had feared.
sentences.sContent_eng: Canada's economy shrank at an annual rate of 5.4% in the first quarter, its biggest decline since 1991, but less than economists had feared.
sentences.sCn: 加拿大经济第一季度以每年5.4%的速度萎缩。这是自1991年以来最大的萎缩，但是没有经济学家害怕的严重。

sentences.sContent: ...which shrank at many retailers due to a strong dollar...
